summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2021 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and FedEx regarding a subpoena for FedEx shipping records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss identifying a records custodian to testify at Maxwell's upcoming trial and obtaining shipment data from 2007-2020.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.context: FedEx senior paralegal corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding subpoenaed FedEx records for Jeffrey Epstein's account and offering to testify if needed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial in New York for which FedEx records are being sought; mentioned as the reason for the records request and trial testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Individual whose FedEx account records (account number 1144-2081-6) are being subpoenaed; emails confirm the search is for data associated with him.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida regarding Epstein.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the FedEx records subpoena; Maxwell's trial is the reason for seeking Epstein's shipping records.
Chapell, as FedEx paralegal, is assisting the prosecution in obtaining records and testimony for Maxwell's trial.
Chapell is handling the subpoena for Epstein's FedEx account records and shipment data from 2007-2020.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: Criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: SD Florida Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008 regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FedEx Shipment Data Period
events.description: FedEx provides a spreadsheet of shipments on Jeffrey Epstein's account from 2007 through 2020 in response to the subpoena.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY subpoenaed FedEx for shipping records associated with Jeffrey Epstein (account number 1144-2081-6) and Ghislaine Maxwell in preparation for Maxwell's November 2021 trial.
FedEx provided shipment data from Epstein's account covering 2007 to 2020, but their IT could not retrieve records prior to 2007.
A previous subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008 also sought FedEx records related to Epstein, with Tracy Ferrara as the FedEx contact.
FedEx senior paralegal Tracy Chapell offered to testify as a records custodian at Maxwell's trial if necessary.
